results.title: Fellini: the director as creator
results.creator_credit: Harold Mantell, Radiotelevisione Italiana and Fulco Film
results.brief_description: This short film on the late, great, Italian film director was the first time motion picture cameras were permitted on the set to reveal his creative process. Harold Mantell’s documentary uses footage shot behind the scenes and on the sets of of Fellini’s film “Juliet of the Spirits” (1965) (304304) as a canvas to talk about this acclaimed director. The film shows the magnificent film sets, Fellini’s character people (whose faces were invented for his films), the relationship with his actor/wife Guilietta Masina, and the cast and crew. The film also features his techniques of improvisation and interview material. “Juliet of the Spirits” is held in the Collection on VHS. While the film is crammed with interesting facts about Fellini, the man and creative artist, it is not intended as a guide to his body of work. Another documentary in the Collection on VHS, “Ciao Frederico: A Portrait Of Frederico Fellini,” was also made during the shooting of “Satyricon”.

results.title: Felidae
results.creator_credit: Sarah Watt, Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Vanessa White
results.brief_description: This hand-drawn animation tells the story of two people’s sightings of a big-cat or panther in the Dandenongs of Melbourne. The visuals accompanying the voice-overs serve to add to the story in more abstract terms with painted film and iconic images of panthers intermixed with the voices.

results.title: Feiz, the last expert
results.creator_credit: Ceda Oketich, Perspective Films and Milan Chupurdija
results.brief_description: This film portrays a man and his son in Belgrade, Yugoslavia, who scratch out a living by travelling the streets in search of pots and pans to repair. The occupation of “tinker” is the focus of this film, one which is seen as diminishing.

results.title: Feet and footwear: caring for your feet
results.creator_credit: TV Ed Productions and Ivan Gaal
results.brief_description: Thomas is one-year old and is fitted for his first pair of shoes. It is an unhappy experience for him and raises questions regarding why we need footwear and why we need to care for our feet. Two podiatrists, a shoe manufacturer and a shoe retailer/fitter share their knowledge and advice relating to feet and footwear.

results.title: Feelings. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Cate Fyffe, Environment Audio Visuals, CVV Productions and Justin Shortal
results.brief_description: A series of vignettes is presented each of which focuses on one of the following feelings: anger; jealousy; rejection and loneliness. The dramatised situations are usually open-ended thus providing a stimulus for discussion. High school students are used to play the roles. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.

results.title: Feelings. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Cate Fyffe, Environment Audio Visuals, CVV Productions and Justin Shortal
results.brief_description: Presents seven separate incidents each with its own title and discussion questions: Smoking and drinking; Adolescents joining in with family activities; Cheating in exams; Aspirations; Losing a loved pet; Friendship and trust; Infatuation and embarrassment. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.

results.title: Feeling good about yourself
results.creator_credit: Feeling Good Associates and Alan Shulman
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the “yes-no” process - a dynamic method of assertiveness training - with a group of intellectually handicapped people. Shows participants in a workshop going through discussion sessions and experiential exercises exploring issues such as victimisation, making oneself understood, self-esteem, personal strength and sex education. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.
